page.title: 08PALACE GATE FARM
page.content: The area between North Warnborough and Odiham is mainly rough grazing land. The secondary cover is residential land. The North Warnborough Village residential estate has several privately owned Tudor cottages. One cottage is called, The Old Post Office To the west of Odiham High Street is Palace Gate Farm. It is a large farm, over a 100 acres, growing wheat,barley and grass. To the north-west runs the Basingstoke Canal. It stretches from Greywell Village to the west of Odiham and joins the Wey-navigation at Weybridge in Surrey.High banks of deciduous trees and rough grazing land surround the canal. Robert May's Secondary-comprehensive school in the area has 1,500 pupils from North Warnborough, Greywell, Hook Hartley Wintney and Odiham. It has a large playing field for games.
